Class BaseBoundary

java.lang.Object
boundary.BaseBoundary
Direct Known Subclasses:
CareerCenterStaffBoundary, CompanyRepBoundary, CompanyRepRegistrationBoundary, LoginBoundary, MainMenuBoundary, StudentBoundary
public class BaseBoundary extends Object
Base class for console UI boundaries providing common input/output helpers and a reference to the AuthController when available.

This class serves as the foundation for all user interface boundaries in the system, providing:

  • Common input validation and parsing utilities
  • Standardized display formatting methods
  • Navigation and confirmation helpers
  • Password change functionality
  • Cancel command recognition
All concrete boundary classes should extend this class to maintain consistent user interaction patterns throughout the application.

  • Field Details

    • sc

      protected final Scanner sc
      Scanner instance for reading user input from standard input

    • auth

      protected final AuthController auth
      Authentication controller for password management (may be null)

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseBoundary

      public BaseBoundary(AuthController auth)
      Creates a boundary with an Authentication controller.

      Use this constructor for boundaries that require password change functionality or other authentication-related features.

      Parameters:
      auth - authentication controller for password changes and user verification

    • BaseBoundary

      public BaseBoundary()
      Creates a boundary without authentication support.

      Use this constructor for boundaries that don't require authentication features, such as registration or public information boundaries.

  • Method Details

    • getRequiredInput

      protected String getRequiredInput(String prompt)
      Prompts for and returns a non-empty string input. Re-prompts until user provides a value.

      This method ensures that required fields are not left empty by continuously prompting the user until valid input is provided.

      Parameters:
      prompt - message to display to the user
      Returns:
      trimmed non-empty user input Usage example: String name = getRequiredInput("Enter your name: ");

    • getOptionalInput

      protected String getOptionalInput(String prompt, String currentValue)
      Prompts for optional string input; returns the current value if user skips (empty response).

      Useful for edit scenarios where existing values should be preserved if the user doesn't want to make changes.

      Parameters:
      prompt - message to display to the user
      currentValue - value to use if user enters nothing
      Returns:
      user input if provided, otherwise the current value Usage example: String newTitle = getOptionalInput("Enter new title [Current: " + currentTitle + "]: ", currentTitle);

    • safeInt

      protected int safeInt(String s, int def)
      Safely parses a string to integer, returning a default value on parse failure.

      This method handles NumberFormatException internally and provides graceful degradation when parsing fails.

      Parameters:
      s - string to parse as integer
      def - default value to return if parsing fails
      Returns:
      parsed integer value, or default value if parsing fails Usage example: int age = safeInt(userInput, 0); // Returns 0 if userInput is not a number

    • promptBoolean

      protected boolean promptBoolean(String message)
      Prompts for a yes/no response with comprehensive input recognition.

      Accepts multiple input formats for affirmative and negative responses:

      • Yes: "1", "y", "yes", "true"
      • No: "0", "n", "no", "false"
      Input is case-insensitive. Re-prompts on unrecognized input.
      Parameters:
      message - question to ask the user
      Returns:
      true for yes responses, false for no responses Usage example: boolean proceed = promptBoolean("Do you want to continue? ");

    • isCancelCommand

      protected boolean isCancelCommand(String input)
      Checks whether input represents a cancel/back/exit command.

      Recognizes the following cancel commands (case-insensitive):

      • "0"
      • "cancel"
      • "back"
      • "quit"
      • "exit"
      Parameters:
      input - user input to check for cancel command
      Returns:
      true if input matches any recognized cancel command, false otherwise

    • displayCancelMessage

      protected void displayCancelMessage()
      Displays a standard operation cancelled message to the user.

      Provides consistent feedback when users cancel operations throughout the application.

    • changePassword

      protected boolean changePassword(String loginKey)
      Prompts user to change their password via the authentication controller.

      Guides the user through the password change process:

      1. Prompts for current password
      2. Prompts for new password
      3. Attempts password change via authentication controller
      4. Provides success/failure feedback
      Returns early if authentication controller is not available.
      Parameters:
      loginKey - user's ID or email to identify them for password change
      Returns:
      true if password change succeeded, false if failed or unavailable
      See Also:
      • AuthController.changePassword(String, String, String)

    • displaySectionHeader

      protected void displaySectionHeader(String title)
      Displays a main section header with title and equals underline.

      Creates a visually distinct section header for major UI sections. Example output: 

      Student Dashboard
================
      Parameters:
      title - header title to display

    • displaySubSectionHeader

      protected void displaySubSectionHeader(String title)
      Displays a subsection header with title and dash underline.

      Creates a visually distinct subsection header for nested UI sections. Example output: 

      Application History
------------------
      Parameters:
      title - subsection title to display

    • displayItemListHeader

      protected void displayItemListHeader(String title)
      Displays a list header (title with blank line before).

      Provides consistent formatting for list displays throughout the application.

      Parameters:
      title - list header title to display

    • confirmAction

      protected boolean confirmAction(String message)
      Prompts user to confirm an action (yes/no).

      Uses the same input recognition as promptBoolean(String) but with a standardized confirmation prompt format.

      Parameters:
      message - action description to confirm
      Returns:
      true if user confirms, false if they decline Usage example: if (confirmAction("Delete this application")) { // Perform deletion }

    • pressEnterToContinue

      protected void pressEnterToContinue()
      Displays a prompt asking user to press Enter to continue; blocks until user does.

      Useful for paging output and ensuring users have time to read information before proceeding to the next screen.
